summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center memorandum detailing the medical emergency response and transport of inmate Jeffrey Epstein to the hospital on August 10, 2019, where he was later taken to the morgue. The document records the timeline and actions of correctional staff during the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who suffered a medical emergency, was transported to the hospital, and was later taken to the morgue.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: Issued instructions to the Internal Security Officer regarding escorting EMTs and the emergency trip to the hospital.

connections.description: The Operations Lieutenant supervised the correctional response to Epstein's medical emergency and directed staff actions.

events.title: Epstein Medical Emergency and Hospital Transport
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein suffered a medical emergency at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, was transported to New York Presbyterian - Lower Manhattan Hospital, and was later taken to the morgue.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
New York Presbyterian â€” Lower Manhattan Hospital, 170 William Street, New York, NY 10038
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein suffered a medical emergency at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:43 am.
Epstein was transported to New York Presbyterian - Lower Manhattan Hospital, arriving at approximately 7:15 am.
Epstein was later transported to the hospital morgue, where correctional staff maintained supervision until approximately 12:57 pm.
The document records the official timeline and procedures followed by correctional staff during the incident.
